text: <extra_id_0> RP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a new member of the adenomatous polyposis coli - binding EB1-like gene family , is differentially expressed in activated T cells .

Cross-linking of the CD3 and <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> molecules on T lymphocytes represents one of the most effective signals for T lymphocyte activation and triggering of their cytotoxic effector function .

To identify genes that are expressed in T cells after stimulation , mRNA from T lymphocytes that had been activated by the simultaneous stimulation of the CD3 and <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> trigger molecules was transcribed for a differential mRNA display analysis into cDNA and was compared with cDNA from <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - or CD3 - activated or resting lymphocytes .
Differential expression was confirmed subsequently by Northern blot analysis .
One of the cDNA fragments expressed specifically in CD3 - and <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - activated T cells was designated RP1 .

The predictive protein - coding region of <extra_id_0> RP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> had a significant homology to members of the recently found <extra_id_0> adenomatous polyposis coli (APC) protein <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - binding <extra_id_0> EB1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene family , which codes for yet unknown protein ( s ) .
Bacterially expressed <extra_id_0> RP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein revealed specific binding to wild-type but not to mutated <extra_id_0> APC <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein .

text: The rapid up-regulation of <extra_id_0> RP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA in properly activated T cells suggests that this gene might belong to the immediate / early gene family , which controls the signal transduction cascade downstream of the TCR .

As the expression level of the <extra_id_0> RP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene in activated T cells and a spectrum of tumor - derived cell lines correlates with the proliferative status of the cells , members of the EB1-like gene family may not only be involved in the tumorigenesis of colorectal cancers but may also play a role in the proliferative control of normal cells .
